Text: Re Enron Data Responses for FERCs Bulk Power Investigation Cc the summary tab on each worksheet for the final figures If you have any questionsconcerns or need additional information please let me know Chris Mary Hain PM To cc Christi Nicolay Bill CT bcc Chris StokleyHOUECT Subject Enron Data Responses for FERCs Bulk Power Investigation Attached find Enron Power Marketing Inc and Enron Energy Services responses to the Staffs data requests in the Federal Energy Regulatory Commissions Bulk Power Investigation These responses assumes that you sent separate data requests to Enron Wind so they do not include that information The answers also assume you are requesting this information for California and therefore the Western interconnect only Please let me know if these assumptions are incorrect If you were requesting Eastern Interconnect information you need to contact Chrisit Nicolay at the above Email address Enron requests confidential treatment of response numbers and pursuant to CFR Section Due to the short turn around time for these requests we were unable to respond to question and to provide the Unit Identifier requested in question We hope to be able to provide this information on Monday Please call me with any questions at I will be traveling on Monday so if you call then call my cell phone at

FW CAISO Notice Cash Allocation PoliciesB NonPrivilegedpst Original Message From Woertz Byron mailto SentTuesday July PM ToISO Market Participants SubjectCAISO Notice Cash Allocation Policies ISO Market Participants Since Trade Month November which settled beginning in January payment defaults in the ISO markets have caused the ISO to pay less than th e full amount due Scheduling Coordinators SCs in the monthly cash clearin g process The purpose of this message is to describe the ISOs policies a nd procedures in settling the market when defaults occur As set forth in Section SABP of the ISO Tariff when payment defaults occur from SCs that have obligations to the ISOs markets Debtor SCs the shortfall is t o be prorated to SCs with net amounts due them Creditor SCs based on thei r outstanding balances The principles that drive how amounts are settled a nd defaults are allocated to Creditor SCs are summarized below Proportionate allocation of defaults The total amount of market defaults is allocated to the Creditor SCs on a proportionate basis such that each Cr editor SC receives the same percentage of their total net amount receivable for the month SCs are allowed to net the credits and debits on a monthly basis as described below The intent of the Tariff is to equitably distri bute market shortfalls only to those SCs that have net market receivables f or the period Each month is treated as a whole period Final and preliminary invoices ar e combined when possible see exception conditions below in allocating mar ket defaults Cash payments from the market are received in two stages pr eliminary and final At preliminary market payments are distributed base d on the preliminary amounts due to the Creditor SCs as set forth in the pr eliminary invoices Final invoices serve essentially as trueups to the pre liminary invoices and accordingly payments received at final are redistri buted to the extent possible to achieve trueup allocations for the whole m onth considering the combined amounts due the Creditor SCs from both the pr eliminary and final invoices Each month is treated as a discrete period Market defaults are generally allocated to the Creditor SCs that have amounts due for the month being set tled The exceptions to this rule involve SCs that are Creditor SCs in the current month but have default obligations relating to prior periods o r Debtor SCs that pay in the current month but have unpaid balances for prior months In the first instance the Creditor SC would not be paid to the extent of default obligations from prior months Amounts due to the C reditor SC would be allocated back to the default period and such proceeds would be allocated based on remaining amounts still owed for that period I n the second instance the current months payment is carried back and appli ed first to the oldest outstanding balance The proceeds would be distribut ed to the Creditor SCs for that earlier period based on the Creditor SCs un paid balances in that month With respect to the carry back of payments to the earliest period Pre and Post bankruptcy debts are deemed to be from d ifferent SCs GMC defaults are remedied as a first priority on market payments GMC is billed separately from market billings on both preliminary and final invoic es each month In the event of payment default on any GMC invoices at eit her preliminary or final market funds are transferred to satisfy GMC obli gations before any market distributions are made This first priority posi tion for GMC revenues is set forth in Section SABP of the ISO Tarif f Therefore when both GMC and market defaults occur as has occurred in each of the past few months the Creditor SCs have two reductions to the m arket clearing amounts ultimately paid an allocated portion of the GMC de fault and an allocated portion of the market default RMR invoices and pa yments are not affected by market or GMC defaults The RMR invoicing proce ss involves amounts due from the PTOs to the RMR Owners as set forth in mo nthly invoices processed through the ISOs systems However such amounts are invoiced independent of the ISOs market and GMC billing processes and accordingly market andor GMC defaults do not impact RMR related payments There are a number of factors that complicate the monthly process of alloca ting cash to Creditor SCs when defaults occur Some of these factors inclu de amounts received after payment date deadlines such amounts are typicall y included in the next distribution market payments due to Creditor SCs that default on GMC in the current mo nth such market allocations are reduced by the specific amount of the GMC default by the Creditor SC allocations to prior months not made unless the amount exceeds of that months billed amounts small invoices under are paid in full rather than the allocated pe rcentage For more information about these allocation issues or any other related mat ters please contact Melodie Iverson email aiso com mailto or Mike Epstein email m mailto at the ISO Byron B Woertz Jr Director Client Relations Phone Pager

FW EPMI PX Account Summary as of August EPMI total of ISO charge type Cc po The attachment in the email below contains the EPMI balance with the PXEPMI xls The Win zip files sent by the ISO contain the backup to the Overview file Chris Original Message From mailto Sent Monday August PM To Stokley Chris Subject EPMI Account Summary as of August Forwarded by Don DeachusersPXCALIF on PM Don Deach AM To EPMI cc Subject EPMI Account Summary as of August PARTICIPANTS Enclosed is your updated Account Activity Statement summarizing all accounts receivablepayables activities with CalPX occurring during starting with the issuance of the December DayAheadDayOf Market invoice back in January through the April Real Time invoices in August The April billing cycles are adjustments being made by CAISO that go back as far as Spring CAISO is continuing to make these adjustments which are basically meter corrections and approved scheduling coordinator disputes for prior periods These will probably continue for a few more months because of the recent FERC ruling regarding refunds Please feel free to call Don Deach Rachel Axelrad or Clark Cheng with any questions Thank You See attached file EPMI xls

FW ERCOT Physical Delivery Progress ReportNonPrivilegedpst FYI Original Message From Ochsner Preston Sent Monday July PM To ONeil Murray P Merola Jeff Phillips George Stokley Chris Busby Todd Raque Michele Fite Rebecca Young Ress Forney John M Miller Jeffrey Misra Narsimha Donovan Terry W Cc Wagner Joseph Nelson Gary Subject ERCOT Physical Delivery Progress Report I need your help to make September physical delivery happen Please talk amongst yourselves and set up meetings as necessary Just keep me in the loop Rogers Herndon and I and others are going to meet this Friday to go over the report Please have your plans of actionfeedbackcomments to me by Thursday morning so I can make sure they get included in the report he sees Thanks for all your help so far Preston x

FW ISO Audit Sample DataNonPrivilegedpst Original Message From Lewchuk Ken Sent Thursday June AM To Stokley Chris Cc Atwood Mechelle Swanson Blake Subject ISO Audit Sample Data Importance High Chris We are planning to use the following days to gather data for the ISO audit Februay June July August December No data is taken from due to the conversion from CHEOPS to MDMA The days represent high UFE days from each quarter of see ISO analysis July and August were included on the resubmittal analysis you provided December is an exit sample from the audit period Please respond with any concerns or comments Thanks Ken

FW CAISO NotificationUnscheduled Demand PenaltyNonPrivilegedpst Original Message From Almeida Keoni mailtoENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESAlmeidaCKeoniCKAlmeidacaisoEcomE NRONcom mailtomailtoIMCEANOTESAlmeidaCKeoniCKAlmeidacaisoEcomE NRONcom Sent Thursday June AM To Stokley Chris Subject FW CAISO NotificationUnscheduled Demand Penalty I think this is a good example to go off of Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page mailto email mailto Original Message From CRCommunications Sent Friday February PM To ISO Market Participants SC Settlements Contacts Cc Gerber Spence Shafa Masoud ISO Client Relations Subject CAISO NotificationUnscheduled Demand Penalty The Unscheduled Demand Penalty was ordered by FERC in its December order to be effective on January Trade Date The ISO is filing a request with FERC to suspend this penalty Additionally SCE and PGE have jointly filed at FERC requesting suspension of the penalty Until FERC provides direction and clarification ISO will calculate the Unscheduled Demand Penalty charges and credits but will not include them in the settlement statements There is no impact to any other charges or payments since the penalty and the allocation of the proceeds is self contained Attached is a description of the Unscheduled Demand Penalty Unscheduled Demand Penaltydoc CRCommunications Client Relations Communications Unscheduled Demand Penaltydoc

FW Gutenberg documentationNonPrivilegedpst Original Message From ONeil Murray P Sent Tue AM To Stokley Chris Cc Subject FW Gutenberg documentation FYIMO Original Message From Dickson Glenn Sent Tuesday June AM To ONeil Murray P Cc Herrera Juan Subject Gutenberg documentation Murray thanks for your interest in leveraging the Gutenberg work Heres the draft Overview The visio documents are not the most current but Ive asked the consultants to produce a binder this morning and also email you all of the most current process flows as well as the Pricing and Booking disconnect detail you requested I d like very much to learn more how you would see expediting progress through the EWS processes and tools and hope youll work with us as soon as possible to see what might be possible Glenn pbgDesign Dev Doc MayAdoc

RE ERCOT Physical Delivery Progress ReportNonPrivilegedpst What was the question Original Message From Phillips George Sent Monday July PM To Ochsner Preston Cc ONeil Murray P Merola Jeff Stokley Chris Miller Jeffrey Wagner Joseph Misra Narsimha Nelson Gary Ruffer Mary Lynne Subject Re ERCOT Physical Delivery Progress Report Attached is the TX market diagram and tentative answers in red to the settlement questions posed below File TXMarketDiagramxls File TXPrestondoc Also regarding the question posed earlier today Marty Sullivan Enrons TXU representative is checking to see if the information you requested is public and available TXU considers industrial customers to be MW He informed me that on September st customer information will be released to marketers There is a possibility that by sorting through this information you can identify the industrial customers in the TXU service territory Please call me with any questions Preston Ochsner PM To Murray P nronXgate Jeff ES George ES Chris nronXgate cc Jeffrey nronXGate Joseph nronXGate Narsimha nronXGate Subject ERCOT Physical Delivery Progress Report While cautious of the issues we face Im very encouraged by your experience and your willingness to help I tried to summarize the issues discussed in the meeting this afternoon in the attached report Please let me know if Ive erroneously attributed your name to an issue Dont pay much attention to the Scenario at the bottom of the report I havent spent much time on it File ERCOT Physical Delivery Processdoc We will continue to fill in the blanks and probably add issues over the next few months My short term goal is to identify the vast majority of the issues and have a plan of action related to those issues within the next week Any feedback you have is welcome

RE Valley PX Losses ActualsNonPrivilegedpst Sorry for my tardiness on this issue I was cleaning my email today and realized that I never got back with you on this topic Go w the original estimates for Valley to bill off of The actuals variance from estimate is immaterial If you have a question call me at Original Message From Choi Paul Sent Monday July PM To Stokley Chris Subject RE Valley PX Losses Actuals give me a call on my cell Original Message From Stokley Chris Sent Monday July PM To Choi Paul Subject RE Valley PX Losses Actuals I will give you a call tomorrow Original Message From Choi Paul Sent Monday July AM To Stokley Chris Subject Valley PX Losses Actuals Chris I need to get these numbers from you Thanks Paul X

GOALS AND ACCOMPLISHMENTSNonPrivilegedpst ACCOMPLISHMENTS Successfully hired trained and implemted a group within VM that acts as the liaison bw Houston Settlements and our Traders Provided guidance to Virginia on what type of reports would be needed for the Traders along w settling up a weekly forum by which she can communicate her issues and results to the traders Helped coordinate a plan of attack on how we would become current on ISO actualizations and on what we would do in the interim Provide leadershipguicance and a shoulder for the group to cry on during a very stressful six months Worked Murray Oneil to provide different reporting units with timely accurate reporting of EPMIs credit position w the ISO and PX Provided solutions that helped manage MidMarketing expectations with what the group could provide in a timely manner due to our technology constraints Made communication and transfer of knowledge a top priority within the group which is now paying off dividends Quite a few members of the group now are able to interchange duties when necessary and therefore able to dilute the stress level of the person that is becoming overwhelmed Came up with the calculation that has the potential to add money to the desk under the current ISO inc dec pricing GOALS To gain more working knowledge of the financial products used by the Commercial units of Enron Successfully complete the EES project by yearend and make a transition to a new rotation Continue to increase my knowledge of relevant software VB Excel Access etc Take courses on financial modeling and statistical analysis Take my knowledge of the both the ENA process and the West market and transfer them over to the EES business unit Gain intimate knowledge of all of the relevant reports and reporting tools that are used within Enron Formulate a clear plan by yearend to where I want to be in the next two years and what I need to do to arrive at my end goal

RE dreamNonPrivilegedpst Yea me giving up what is with that So I got to go out like a punk and you went down in a blaze of glory beautiful How is everything going in the wonderful PacifiCorp world Did you ever settle into a specific job or do still move around Risk group seems to be doing better they even get to get off early one day a week I am pretty much spending all of my time in Houston working on the EES project kinda sucks s far as the travel goes I dont know if you heard but we lost Sean could lose more at year end when all of the contracts come to duration Chris Original Message From Sabo Valarie Valarie acifiCorpcomENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESSaboCValarieCValarieESaboPacifiCorpEcomE NRONcom Sent Wednesday June PM To Stokley Chris Subject dream had a dream last night actually this morning and you were in it We were running from the cops You gave up Whats with that

RE Todays pm mtngNonPrivilegedpst Maurice Thursday at pm would be fine for all of us involved in the meeting Chris Original Message From Winter Maurice Sent Wed AM To Frazier Michael Stokley Chris Bresnan Neil Cc Subject Todays pm mtng Gentlemen I have been pulled into an emergency task force this morning by Evan Hughes to address some CA issues for which you are probably aware Therefore I must reschedule our meeting for tomorrow afternoon or Friday I would like to try pm on Thurs What are your schedules looking like

FW funnyNonPrivilegedpst Original Message From Forney John M Sent Tuesday June PM To Stokley Chris Subject funny Remember how bad TA reported that we all were on putting cuts into the system enpower work reconciliation etc THESE GUYS DO NONE OF THAT NO ONE EVEN KNOWS HOW Settlements is working hard but TA doesnt say a word to the RT traders here as it would be political suicide Thats why she turned toward us She is supposed to be our rep to the ISO and I talked to her explaining my expectations She was squirming about saying that she or Rebecca wouldnt know the answers Im cool with that but cant you find out Everything is such a big struggle here Im not coming until February at the earliest I am an Oregonian The freaking mosquitos are terrible now that the floodwaters have subsided I forgot about that bit of joy Later JMf

RE Load Forecasting access to MV interval data Cc NonPrivilegedpst Tuesday works better for me Maurice my flight does not arrive into Houston until pm tonight As far as a time for Tuesday I would say anytime after am would be open on my schedule Chris Original Message From Winter Maurice Sent Mon AM To Bresnan Neil Cc Frazier Michael Stokley Chris Subject Re Load Forecasting access to MV interval data Neil Pat is meeting with the CAISO auditors all afternoon but I have asked if she can give us some time after pm If she is not available what time tommorow morning is good for you Chris and Micheal Also I have attached the CSC systems drawing that I spoke of in our last meeting Maurice CES System Overview bmp Enron Energy Services From Neil Bresnan AM To Michael ES cc Maurice ES Chris nronXgate Subject Re Load Forecasting access to MV interval data Maurice I have PRC Monday If we have the meeting with Pat at PM I should be able to make it Please send me an email to confirm the time and location NFB Michael Frazier PM To Maurice ES cc Neil ES Chris nronXgate Gregg ES James ES Subject Re Load Forecasting access to MV interval data Sounds like a feasible solution to me as long as we can get specified formats and the data uploads are wellmaintained by CSC Are there any extra costs on their end for performing this posting function mrf Maurice Winter AM To Neil ES Chris nronXgate Michael ES cc Gregg ES James ES Subject Load Forecasting access to MV interval data All I spoke with Pat Priestley this morning about our request to get access to the MV daily interval meter data for load forecasting She said that she would not be available to meet formally until Monday due to the declared disaster at their operations due to the flood She said they are moving back to the Pennzoil building today and Friday so things should be close to normal by Monday Pat said that it is not be a problem to export the MV data in just about any format on a daily basis for us The data is housed in MV databases which according to Pat can only be read by an MV system so we would need to purchase MV very expensive if we wanted to read the data directly I suggest we get the data exported daily from CSC to an FTP site at Enron because they can manage the process on a daily basis We can sweep the FTP site daily and have it automatically imported into our databases If we are in agreement with this solution I will create an emergency work request with CSC to begin working on this immediately Maurice

FW Meter Operations UpdateNonPrivilegedpst FYI Original Message From Phillips George Sent Wednesday June AM To Carter Pamela Ruffer Mary Lynne Stokley Chris Subject Meter Operations Update Forwarded by George PhillipsHOUEES on AM mailto on PM To mailto cc Subject Meter Operations Update Forwarded by Patricia G PriestleyCEGCSC on PM Patricia G PriestleyCEGCSC PM To mailto mailto mailto mailto cc Dionne L SC mailto SC Jo Ellen SC mailto SC Subject Meter Operations Update Attached is a summary of the impacted areas and a current status of Meter Operations due to Houston flooding Meter reading and posting of data We are currently unable to readpost interval data for California or Phoenix While the electricity has been restored phone lines are still inoperable meaning we are unable to read phone or wireless meters Since the phone system to the building had extensive water damage we are not sure when the lines will be available Backup operations are being developed in Dublin but are not yet functional Settlements for EEMC Files for EEMC have been posted through Sunday the th for day April Day files for due Monday the th and due today the th have not been produced We are unable to communicate with our servers because of the phone outage and are therefore unable to create the files remotely Through today we have been denied access to our building Our plan is to seek access on Wednesday at least long enough to generate our files and submit them remotely using a laptop Settlements for EESO Files for EESO have been posted through Sunday settlement file for day We are able to generate settlement files offsite and are working to submit Mondays and Tuesdays file by midnight today My plan is to produce these daily updates until all of our operations are back in place and on schedule Please contact me with any questionspager pin

FW Meeting RequestNonPrivilegedpst Original Message From Liscano Christina Sent Wednesday June PM To Palma Viviana Garcia Nidia Bryant Rachel Carrizales Blanca Botello Leticia Cc Stokley Chris Richter Jeff Symms Neal Subject Meeting Request Scott Mills has requested a meeting to discuss Service Management Settlements Please check your respective managers calendar and let me know their availability for Friday June th Chris Jeff Neal Please let me know of your availability for Friday June th Meeting Invitees Greg Young Anthony Dayao Rogers Herndon Don Black Chris Stokley Jeff Richter Brenda Herod Beth Apollo Neal Symms Evan Hughes Thank you Christina ext

FW Load Forecasting access to MV interval dataNonPrivilegedpst Original Message From Winter Maurice Sent Thursday June AM To Bresnan Neil Stokley Chris Frazier Michael Cc Young Gregg Light James Subject Load Forecasting access to MV interval data All I spoke with Pat Priestley this morning about our request to get access to the MV daily interval meter data for load forecasting She said that she would not be available to meet formally until Monday due to the declared disaster at their operations due to the flood She said they are moving back to the Pennzoil building today and Friday so things should be close to normal by Monday Pat said that it is not be a problem to export the MV data in just about any format on a daily basis for us The data is housed in MV databases which according to Pat can only be read by an MV system so we would need to purchase MV very expensive if we wanted to read the data directly I suggest we get the data exported daily from CSC to an FTP site at Enron because they can manage the process on a daily basis We can sweep the FTP site daily and have it automatically imported into our databases If we are in agreement with this solution I will create an emergency work request with CSC to begin working on this immediately Maurice

FW ISONonPrivilegedpst I think that these are all of the documents that you were unable to open from my previous emails Chris Original Message From Stokley Chris Sent Wednesday June AM To Atwood Mechelle Subject RE ISO Mechelle Sorry for the delay on getting you the documents in question I currently can not get into Lotus Notes where all of the documents reside The IT group is looking into the problem and I will get the documents to you the moment that I have access to Lotus Notes again Chris Original Message From Atwood Mechelle Sent Monday June PM To Stokley Chris Subject ISO Hello Chris It was nice to meet you last Friday I wanted to remind you to please reemail me those documents as soon as you get a chance Id like to get through those and have a plan re dates staff etc by midweek this week Please call if you have any questions Thanks Mechelle Atwood Director Enron Assurance Services Enron Wholesale Services Location EB mailto

RE Disconnect Cc poNonPrivilegedpst George Questions What DA and RT Excel reports are you referencing in the email below The only report that my group currently sends out is the ISO HA Final which comes from Jim Reyes Who are the contacts that are sending you these reports and what are the timelines in which you receive these reports after the date of physical flow Please send me and example of both the reports and the discrepancies that you have encountered along w your process for booking the information given in the reports I think that you are probably referring to the reports that Kate Symes and the RT group send out but I dont want to jump to that conclusion without you confirming that to be true Any information you can give me on the process will be helpful in coming up w a solution to the issues that you are running into Thanks Chris Original Message From Phillips George Sent Tuesday June AM To Stokley Chris Cc Couch Brooklyn Ruffer Mary Lynne Subject Disconnect Chris Recently the Excel files for the DA and RT markets that are sent to populate EES DealTracker do not tie to the EnPower file sent to us later This has caused all parties increased investigation time and could cause potential delays in the booking of accruals Recently the scenario is occuring more frequently I wanted to bring this matter to your attention now to avoid any delays Thank you in advance for any assistance you can provide to make the process smoother If you have any questions please contact me George

FW SAR Report Ready for User Testing in StageNonPrivilegedpst Original Message From Pate Brett Sent Friday June AM To Stokley Chris Subject SAR Report Ready for User Testing in Stage Importance High Chris A request was put in from Mike Tully to add exporting funtionality to the Scheduling Activity Report SAR This functionality has been added and is now currently in Stage ready for user testing I spoke with David Poston about who to contact for this and he directed me to you If you have any questions please let me know also please email me back if the report is fine so I can put the request in to move it to production The Stage Version is Thanks Brett Pate Enpower QA Original Message From Tully Michael Sent Tuesday March AM To Smith Will F Cc Poston David Subject RE SAR Report Hey good morning Will I was out yesterday so I could not get in touch with you Sorry Anyway the problem is that the SAR report has no way to save the data to anything other than its own special format We need the ability to save this data into a CSV type file The reason for this is that we sometimes send this report to customers and presently they cannot view the information We also share this report with our traders who need immediate access to this report and cannot view it unless they take the time to Open up Enpower and then view the report through there This presents a problem as most of the time Enpower is so slow Is there any way that we can have an option to save the data to either a CSV Type or as an Excel Document Thanks Mike

RE UPDATENonPrivilegedpst A leopard never changes its spots Is this an after thought since they heard you were going to leave I would be worried about any position that I felt needed arm twisting to get to in the end Sounds like a good opportunity but I wonder why it is now coming to the surface and what is behind it I am bias I dont trust anyone on that side of the pond so I may not be the best person to give an objective answer You have a good feel for people go w your gut You knew in you the back of your mind that this is the way that it would go down at the end of the day Get some more opinions and then go w your instincts Chris Original Message From Forney John M Sent Thursday June AM To Stokley Chris Subject RE UPDATE The opportunity here has been enhanced in addition to Managing RT I would be managing all of the Service Assets in Texas This includes trading around a mw plant serving EES and New Power Company loads and also the potential for managing a new mw full requirements deal Of course I would have to have all of this in writing I would be working with the Texas Term trader to enhance my trading skills in order to effectively manage this position This makes the offer more attractive but still I would be in Houston I am still apprehensive of the bait switch exposure What do you think JMF Original Message From Stokley Chris Sent Wednesday June PM To Forney John M Subject UPDATE Anything new going on w your current hunt for opportunities Chris

FW Your May Pay AdviceNonPrivilegedpst FYI Original Message From Enron NRON mailto NRON mailtoIMCEANOTESEnronAnnouncementsCorpEnron NRONcom mailtomailtoIMCEANOTESEnronAnnouncementsCorpEnron NRONcom On Behalf Of Integrated Solutions NRON mailto NRON Sent Wednesday May PM To DL Pay NRON mailto NRON Subject Your May Pay Advice This message is to inform you that information contained on your printed pay advice for the pay period ending May may be misleading Regardless of whether you have single or multiple direct deposits your net pay is correct but your pay advice will indicate that all of your pay has been deposited collectively to Other Bank It does not list specific bank accounts However if you view your pay advice in eHRonline you will be able to confirm your scheduled direct deposits and verify the accounts to which the deposits were made You may access eHRonline and view your pay advice by taking the following steps Click the following link to open eHRonline Read the disclaimer Click Accept Type your SAP Logon ID eg your P ID in the User Id field Enter your SAP password in the Password field Click the Logon button Select Paycheck Inquiry from the dropdown list Click the radio button next to Results in Period to select the default for the May pay advice Click the Continue button Click the link for the pay period to display your pay advice Scroll to the bottom of the screen to view your direct deposit details If you have additional questions about your pay advice or accessing eHRonline please contact the ISC Customer Care Group at or mailto Thank you

RE Settlement Update Cc NonPrivilegedpst Pat The files are checked by EPMI on a daily basis however nothing is done w these files until an explanation is sent as to why they are being resubmitted In our process we need to be able to explain both the reason for the resubmital and the MW variance to the ISO Chris Original Message From ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESppriestcscEcom NRONcom On Behalf Of Sent Wednesday May AM To Stokley Chris Cc Subject Settlement Update All since our last meeting heres where we are now In summary our late submissions for early March dates were due to missing load profiles in our manually run estimation database Once the problem was detected and corrected on day for settlement the process began to generate and regenerate the files from forward A second problem was detected on that caused high loads for SCE in settlement files The MDMA system which generates the actual usage settlement file was incorrectly updated from our STAT system causing the MDMA system to calculate incorrect settlement numbers for an incorrect set of customers primarily those customers in SCE which had rolled back to bundled service These files were posted to sparky and are now being corrected for resubmission to sparky The load differences will be sent to you as the corrections are made Observations and changes to procedure We were unaware that sparky was not manually checked on a daily basis for late postings We became aware of this on when Chris called to find our why all of the late files were sitting on sparky Going forward Chris I will let you all know of any late submissions Do you Chris need notification on all postings or just the ones that are after day We are securing a full time settlement person who will be in a position to detect problems at the time the file is generated and move more quickly toward resolving problems Steve Walker is working with Mike Frazier on the request for account usage etc listing Update on MDMA system generated estimates Still testing fine tuning the missing accounts selection calculations look good With all of the above interruptions this has taken a bit of a backseat during the past couple of weeks Give me a call if you need more details or have questions See attached file PostingStatsxls PostingStatsxls File PostingStatsxls

FW EESNonPrivilegedpst Original Message From Kimball Jr Wayne Sent Monday May AM To Stokley Chris Subject RE EES Whats up Chris I havent heard from you in a while I dont know how things are going to pan out with the reorg but I think the reorg is being done out of necessity I dont know who Don Black is I know that when he came in Dennis Benevides reported to him He moved Dennis off of the Power Desk and put Neil Bresnan in charge Obviously his role has expanded Will your group be reporting to him now Rick Baltz was our Director when Derenda and I left He has since moved over to work for Evan Hughes Mary Lynn Ruffer is now over the group George Phillips is managing the settlementsvolume control function At least this is my understanding I think Derenda will be a much happier person wherever she is going Its too bad that she had to get a raw deal in order for her to find happiness but thats the way the world works sometimes So what all are you going to be doing over the next months Is it strictly related to volume management Is it only related to the West Maybe we can grab some lunch when you come to Houston Talk to you later Wayne Original Message From Stokley Chris Sent Friday May PM To Kimball Jr Wayne Subject EES Wayne What do think of the latest reorg and the email we got from Derenda Do you have any insight into what is going on over in the EES world It looks like I will be on the team that helps sort all of this out and I wanted to see if you had any knowledge on Don Black Also who is the gentleman that caused you and Derenda so much grief I guess this all worked out well for you in the end since you wont have to sweat all of the decisions that are about to take place for that area of the business I more than likely will be in Houston quite a bit over the next mts so I will swing by and visit with you and Chad when I find out my schedule Hope all is going well Derenda told me that you were enjoying your job Chris

FW Status of Actualizations October Deviation Preliminaries and Finals and Other FinalsNonPrivilegedpst Original Message From Emmert Caroline Sent Thursday May PM To Stokley Chris Cc ONeil Murray P Johnson Donna Subject FW Status of Actualizations October Deviation Preliminaries and Finals and Other Finals I spent several hours with TJ shadowing and we tested the code while I examined results As each error or incorrect result was noted we went to the code and walked through and made changes TJ is now running actual dates and we will check them in the morning When all is well we will run the rest of October Next we will perform the same testing and coding revisions for only need to test for EPMIside exceptions and then we will be able to run for the month After the latest unsuccessful run of I delved into the specific details of the variances and all of the material volumes are included in the Finals so any allocations that would be created as a result of those variances would be reversed when I run the Final actualization So this morning I manually calculated appropriate allocations for our Load customers the variances are due to resubmitted meter data entered the values in the ProRata allocation table created an additional allocation for the remaining MW variance matched all up to the ISO and completed for Preliminaries I have actualized the regular stuff and set to M through October I will wrap those up on Friday At this point in time we are on target for completion of Prelims by Friday afternoon but Finals may not be done until Monday Caroline Original Message From Emmert Caroline Sent Wednesday May PM To Stokley Chris Cc Johnson Donna ONeil Murray P Subject FW Status of Actualizations October Deviation Preliminaries and Finals and Other Finals Anna and I worked through the coding for and she made some changes to the method for finding percent usage I reran the tool and looked at the results and we still do not have valid allocations On October we now have an MW difference between the variance and the amount allocated Will look into it again tomorrow is nearly complete Ran into an error while running a test day and I will discuss it with TJ tomorrow should be a quick fix once we get the exceptions working properly I have actualized finals on the regular charges through October and should be able to wrap up most if not all of the rest tomorrow If we can get them working properly tomorrow then I will be able to finish the Prelims on Friday and the Finals on Monday Caroline Original Message From Emmert Caroline Sent Tuesday May PM To Stokley Chris Johnson Donna Subject Status of Actualizations October Deviation Preliminaries and Finals and Other Finals Exception handling coding changes are nearly complete TJ had to weave through the code for all the way as well as add new function points EPMI exceptions ISO exceptions and repeating scavenging he calls it the exception roll up function from another module He has a test environment set up and is testing EPMI variance allocations EPMI exceptions and ISO exceptions He has not yet done the scavenging part He will be finished with tonight and tomorrow I will test the results on one of the days where I had samples of these exceptions The part of that needs to be changed is for EPMI exception handling which should be a much less involved endeavor For I attempted to follow all of the queries through to see if I could run some tests within the environment and determine what was being pulled as a variance and how that variance was being allocated However these queries are currently beyond my expertise I plan to rectify that We are going to enlist Annas help as much as possible for and get to the bottom of what is happening As a side note for the time change date we have an extra HE and the ISO has HE We are also going to get with Anna on how to resolve that For the regular actualizations I have set except to M today There is a strange anomaly going on on the th and neither Donna nor I could figure out what I will get back to it Anticipate completion of all by Monday May Caroline To Chris nronXgate mailto nronXgate Donna nronXgate mailto nronXgate cc Subject Status of Actualizations October Deviation Preliminaries and Other Finals Exception handling in and not coded properly Tj working on enhancing the codes to handle them correctly and anticipates being done with by tomorrow afternoon and by midday Wednesday Final actualizations for the regular charge codes are complete and set to M through October Will perform additional research into the improper allocations for on Tuesday The unallocated volume on is approx MW so I will focus my research on that day Estimate completion date of all deviations prelim and final and regular charge codes final Monday May Caroline Forwarded by Caroline EmmertHOUECT on PM To Chris CT mailto CT Donna CT mailto CT cc Subject Status of Deviation Actualizations October Preliminaries I have started the actualization process with Load Deviation and need to work closely with TJ on Monday to find out why the allocations dont match the variances I have isolated one day zone and hour and will work on that with him We have got to get it working properly or else there will be a lot of manual work required Export Deviation is complete for October and the records can be set to A with the other days as normal Import Deviation needs the new calcs that will be provided by a rerun of SettleSupplemental which I am going to kick off just before I leave I will run that on Monday while TJ is researching the errorsproblems Gen Deviation will also be started on Monday Tentative target date for completion of Prelims is next Thursday and Finals on Friday See you Monday Caroline

RE Organization AnnouncementNonPrivilegedpst First off I am still confused on how this whole thing plays out myself I will be flying into Houston quite a lot in the short term to get a feeling for what is currently in place for EES Tim wants Don Black to stay in place for the short term to help him make his way through this mess called EES Don Black has not been with EES that long so he is not being hit w any of the blame for the current problems I should have a clearer picture of what is going on in the next couple of weeks Ps I am now an Associate Chris Original Message From Monica CT mailtoIMCEANOTESMonicaLandePDXECT NRONcom On Behalf Of Lande Monica Sent Friday May AM To Stokley Chris Subject Re Organization Announcement I give up I am so confused How does this play out with the Portland office will you be working with Don Enron Americas Office of the Chairman From Enron Americas Office of the NRON on CDT Sent by Enron NRON To All Enron Worldwide cc Subject Organization Announcement Given the growth in EES it has become apparent that it is time to consolidate the risk functions between EES and EWS This will provide EES with the systems resources and risk expertise of the wholesale energy groups necessary for it to continue to grow and take advantage of current market opportunities With this in mind and in agreement with the management of EES two new risk groups inside Enron Americas will be formed to provide EES with pricing structuring retail and wholesale commodity risk management logistics and backoffice services These groups main function is to provide these services to EES We have asked Rogers Herndon currently Vice PresidentTrading in the Eastern Power Group to manage this function in the Eastern Interconnect this includes both gas and power Rogers will continue to report to Kevin Presto We have asked Don Black formerly Vice PresidentEES Risk Management and Sourcing to manage this function in the Western US Don will manage this group from Houston and will report to Tim Belden These groups will work very closely with EES to pursue shared goals while ensuring close coordination with the wholesale gas and power trading organizations These changes are effective immediately Please congratulate Rogers and Don on their new roles John Lavorato Louise Kitchen

MEETING W TIMNonPrivilegedpst Kristian I met with Tim today to inform him of my intentions to pursue opportunities outside of the Portland office It seem to go very well w TIm also saying that he had expressed an interest in working in London He did make sure and state that the London office is the highest cost office in all of Enron and therefore would probably be the first on to experience layoffs if the economy took a downturn His thought is that he wants to see if he can get me into something on the floor by mid year but would support me if I decide to go elsewhere The tougher issue is going to be telling Murray of my intentions What do I do now to start truly pursuing a job in the London office Chris

Meeting with Houston SettlementsNonPrivilegedpst Caroline While I agree with you that having you go to Houston would be productive it is a luxury that we cannot afford We are currently four and a half months behind on our actualization process with both the internal and external customers running out of patience With also have Brett leaving this Friday and Donna out until next week I need you to focus solely on getting us actualized for the months in question We also have a deliverable to Seattle City Light by the end of this week Until we get these items settled I can not allow the transition of duties between yourself and Virginia to take place as we had planned We all want this transition to happen but we have to get these deliverables out the door I hope that you can understand that with all of these issues on the VM plate my answer will have to be no to your going to Houston Chris Forwarded by Chris StokleyHOUECT on PM Caroline Emmert AM To Chris CT cc Virginia CT Subject Meeting with Houston Settlements Chris I understand that Virginia has been approached to head down to Houston and meet with the Settlements group I would like to be part of that as well if that is alright There are still some things they do on their side that I would like to learn about and I think that Virginia and I could collaborate on a sharing of information meeting and both would get a lot out of it Let me know I guess the date hasnt been settled yet but I am available pretty much any time in the next few weeks C

FW WIP for MV dataNonPrivilegedpst Original Message From Rutledge John Sent Thursday July AM To mailto Stokley Chris Frazier Michael Cc Miller Richard Winter Maurice Ha Kenny Gullion Steven Subject WIP for MV data Steve Heres a quick synopsis of what we need Users want actual historical metered data If they cant get the data before it has been EEVd by MV they need to know for each value whether it is the actual metered amount or an estimated value Users understand that there may be missing data but do not require the metadata detailing this However this is with the understanding that the backfill data will eventually arrive at some later date We want any account and meterdescriptive data as well as the associated volumetric data A test file to see what kind of data are available and a few consecutive days worth of data to get a feel for volumes are needed If data is received from am how soon after am can we get a file Please do not burn in this process just yet because data and timing requirements may change Chris With the bullets above Steve has promised to turn around the completed WIP by COB today or tomorrow morning Hopefully this will at least get the ball rolling It is then up to the business to determine whether to proceed and how to prioritze it There must be concerted effort from the business to prioritize requests to CSC Steve gave me Richard Millers name as the EES coordinator for these requests Please contact him and let me know what you find out Going forward we MUST establish who is responsible for filling these things out and keeping track of them Ive heard different things from different people and I dont want to end up nor should anyone else being the person who fields random and anonymous lobs from the other side of the fence Cheers John

PM To cc Donna CT Subject Question about InstructedUninstructed Energy Data Usage Keoni We are still struggling to fully understand the InstructedUninstructed Energy data IE specifically the two columns that report Uninstructed Deviation and Uninstructed Energy The volumetric totals in one of these two columns is supposed to match the volume in the Settlement Detail file for Charge Type However I have discovered a couple of annoying things in September In comparing the two columns within the table For LocationTypes L and C there is no volumetric difference between the two columns For LocationType G there is a volumetric difference of more in the Deviation column than in the Energy column In comparing IE to the Settlement Statement data When I use the volumes in the Uninstructed Energy column for all LocationTypes I have a volumetric difference of less in the IE data However when I use the Uninst Energy column for L and C and the Deviation column for G I then have a volumetric difference of less in the Settlement Statement Detail data My question is two or severalfold What causes the volumes in the two columns to be different for the G type I could find no discernable value to make it change anywhere in the data Which column has the values that the ISO uses in determining the total net position for EPMI Why dont the two sets of volumes match IE to Settlement I really need to understand this as we are required to tie all of our customers volumes back to the Settlement Statement file and again when the backup file doesnt match or is inconsistent that makes our goals that much harder to achieve Caroline

Re HA Final Schedules for EES PGES for NonPrivilegedpst Pamela Where do you get the numbers for the EEMC tab Here are the stages of the process that I currently know about EES sends the schedule file to the EPMI server Calf schedulers pull EES schedules into their portfolio and submit the information to the ISO ISO sends back Day Ahead Finals Changes could occur with EES original schedule ISO Sends back Hour Ahead Finals Changes could occur with EES schedule from the Day Ahead Market As you can see there is quite a few places that changes can occur to an EES schedule in the course of a day So I am trying to follow the information flow on both the EES side and the EPMI side If the only schedule you see is the one that is originally sent to the EPMI server then I can see where we have the potential to have many unexplained variances If this is the case this may be nothing more than providing you with the incremental information that is provided by the ISO during the course of a given day Just update me on your process flow and I will keep this issue moving along until completion Thanks Chris To Chris CT cc Subject Re HA Final Schedules for EES PGES for Chris the spreadsheet below contains the HAFinals that you send to meEPMI as well as the scheduled volumes sent from the scheduling groupEES The volumes on the EPMI tab is inconsistent with the EEMC tab Please review the variance sheet tab which will denote the days zone and hours where the difference occur I am assuming the EPMI numbers are incorrect because of the hour by hour consistency on the EEMC spreadsheet However this assumption could be incorrect Again please review and let me know Thanks Pam Embedded StdOleLink

Electric System Operation for the NonEngineer CourseNonPrivilegedpst Forwarded by Chris StokleyHOUECT on PM Jessica Burry PM To Donna CT Chris CT Mark CT Eric CT Bill Williams CT Elliot CT Jeffrey CT Laura CT Jonalan CT Todd CT Andy CT Angela CT Jeff G CT Fredrik CT Chris CT Jesse CT Crystal CT Glenn CT Michael CT Christopher F CT Jake CT cc Grace CT Mollie CT Theresa CT Kathryn CT Subject Electric System Operation for the NonEngineer Course The Electric System Operation for the NonEngineer course is scheduled to take place this Friday Saturday April th th from am to pm I have listed below a brief description of the course overview and location I can be reached at if you have any questions Location Meal Schedule World Trade Center am Coffee Bagels Served Mezzanine Level Oregon Room pm Lunch Served SW Salmon pm Drink Refreshments Breaks Every min Overview The twoday workshop provides you with a comprehensive understanding of system operations including fossil fuel hydro and nuclear generation transmission and distribution The course will provide not only technical information but also economics of operation system and equipment protection and safety Course Highlights Generation Transmission Overhead Distribution Systems Underground Distribution Switchgear Voltage Control Matching Generation Day one Day Two am am Coffee Bagels Served Coffee Bagels Served pm pm Generation Underground Distribution Construction and operation Padmount transformers underground of steam hydro and gas cable conduit and reliability overhead turbine generators versus underground Transmission and Overhead Swithgear Distribution Systems Circuit switches fuses and cut outs Power and distribution transformers Wye and Delta overhead Voltage Control distribution systems Voltage control using noload tap changers load tap changers and voltage regulators Power and energy calculations Matching Generation Automotive versus manual matching of generation to load transmission intertie Adjourn

RE Enron chargesNonPrivilegedpst Thanks for you help Original Message From Almeida Keoni mailto Sent Wednesday August PM To Stokley Chris Subject Enron charges File Keonizip Keonizip Chris per your request here are the and charges that have been tracked to date for Enron Please keep in mind that the systems have not been built to incorporate this data into our Settlements process so the normal validations built into our Settlements process are not applied to the manual tracking of these charges Therefore this data should not be considered Settlement quality If these charges ever to become effective the proper systems will be built to pull in this data into the Settlement process I checked with some folks and found out that FERC should rule on this during September Take care Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto

FW CAISO NotificationUnscheduled Demand PenaltyNonPrivilegedpst Original Message From Almeida Keoni mailtoENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESAlmeidaCKeoniCKAlmeidacaisoEcomE NRONcom mailtomailtoIMCEANOTESAlmeidaCKeoniCKAlmeidacaisoEcomE NRONcom Sent Thursday June AM To Stokley Chris Subject FW CAISO NotificationUnscheduled Demand Penalty I think this is a good example to go off of Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page mailto email mailto Original Message From CRCommunications Sent Friday February PM To ISO Market Participants SC Settlements Contacts Cc Gerber Spence Shafa Masoud ISO Client Relations Subject CAISO NotificationUnscheduled Demand Penalty The Unscheduled Demand Penalty was ordered by FERC in its December order to be effective on January Trade Date The ISO is filing a request with FERC to suspend this penalty Additionally SCE and PGE have jointly filed at FERC requesting suspension of the penalty Until FERC provides direction and clarification ISO will calculate the Unscheduled Demand Penalty charges and credits but will not include them in the settlement statements There is no impact to any other charges or payments since the penalty and the allocation of the proceeds is self contained Attached is a description of the Unscheduled Demand Penalty Unscheduled Demand Penaltydoc CRCommunications Client Relations Communications Unscheduled Demand Penaltydoc

regarding prioritization CSC handles multiple often independent requests from ENA as well as EES many of which are of the we need this as soon as possible variety What they want from us not just EES but Enron as a whole is a prioritization of all of these outstanding requests not just what our group might have asked of them Sorry about the confusion John Forwarded by John RutledgeHOUEES on AM Embedded Enron Energy Services image moved to file From John Rutledge picpcx AM To Chris nronXgate Michael ES cc Richard ES Maurice ES Kenny ES Steven ES Subject WIP for MV data Steve Heres a quick synopsis of what we need Users want actual historical metered data If they cant get the data before it has been EEVd by MV they need to know for each value whether it is the actual metered amount or an estimated value Users understand that there may be missing data but do not require the metadata detailing this However this is with the understanding that the backfill data will eventually arrive at some later date We want any account and meterdescriptive data as well as the associated volumetric data A test file to see what kind of data are available and a few consecutive days worth of data to get a feel for volumes are needed If data is received from am how soon after am can we get a file Please do not burn in this process just yet because data and timing requirements may change Chris With the bullets above Steve has promised to turn around the completed WIP by COB today or tomorrow morning Hopefully this will at least get the ball rolling It is then up to the business to determine whether to proceed and how to prioritze it There must be concerted effort from the business to prioritize requests to CSC Steve gave me Richard Millers name as the EES coordinator for these requests Please contact him and let me know what you find out Going forward we MUST establish who is responsible for filling these things out and keeping track of them Ive heard different things from different people and I dont want to end up nor should anyone else being the person who fields random and anonymous lobs from the other side of the fence Cheers John See attached file picpcx picpcx picpcx This RE LA Spin Deal entryNonPrivilegedpst Agreed J Original Message From Rosman Stewart Sent Tuesday August AM To Stokley Chris Subject RE LA Spin Deal entry Hey buddy you know me and deal entry i think this is pretty impressive Stewart Original Message From Stokley Chris Sent Tuesday August AM To Rosman Stewart Bresnan Neil Cc Richter Jeff Subject RE LA Spin Deal entry Thank God we brought Stewart in to clear all of this up Original Message From Rosman Stewart Sent Tuesday August AM To Bresnan Neil Cc Stokley Chris Richter Jeff Subject LA Spin Deal entry This email is to summarize how i think we are going to book the LA AS transactions so as to ensure smooth settlements and month end Whoever intiates the deal will put in two enpower transactions Transaction One This one represents ENA buying AS from LA at the agreed upon capacity price and volume Transaction Two This one represents ENA selling AS to EES at an agreed upon price and volume Once Bill finishes his assessment of work he will work with Neil to determine what fee is appropriate this fee will be embedded in the price he sells to EES Lastly any time the AS gets exercised Bills group will put the energy in caps and enpower If you have any questions or comments on the process let me know Stewart

RE meter data documentation Cc po NonPrivilegedpst Brenda Here are the events as I know them On this item was brought to the attention of varies members of a team meeting for Project Ranger At that point it was agreed that this item should be high priority and Robert Bailey offered to push it forward On Friday I got a call from John Rutledge asking if he is the person that is supposed to enter the WIP to CSC John had never had any dealing w filling out a WIP plus he is unsure if he is the person to fill it out Ball drop number one WIP is finally submitted on I got a call from Jacqueline Johnson on asking a bunch of questions about the work request that was submitted by John At that point I ask why I am just now being contacted if the WIP was submitted on Monday Jacqueline then goes on to tell me that she has not been in the office that week and is just now getting around to reviewing our WIP request I then ask why she did not have a backup covering her during her absence and told her she needs to get this out the door ASAP Ball drop number two Brenda sends out an email on Friday asking for an update from Richard Miller on the CSC issue Yesterday at about I sent an email to Richard asking for an up date on the email that Brenda sent out I then get a call from Richard and Steve Walker in which they both told me that this item is not showing as an emergency item to CSC Both told me that it was never conveyed to them that this was an emergency item but they will now escalated it to such Ball drop number three In summary John should have been given a lot more guidance in filling the WIP out and getting it submitted to CSC since he has no prior relationship with CSC As far as the rest of the items listed I am unsure of where the disconnect in communication occurred at this time Lastly where does Robert Gresch fit in all of this since he is the one that I conveyed my concern about this item not looking like it was escalated to emergency status Chris Stokley FW ContractsNonPrivilegedpst FYI Original Message From Herod Brenda F Sent Sunday August PM To ONeil Murray P Donovan Terry W Denner Mark Hughes Evan Cc Stokley Chris Apollo Beth Stubblefield Wade Subject RE Contracts Murray Thanks for the info and the ideas We will talk on Monday when you get into the office Terry Evan and Mark I am trying to determine if EES customers have been invoiced in compliance with the contract anywhere there is language regarding consumption bands overunder takes There is at least one thought throughout the organization that penalties have never been invoiced if a customers usage was outside of the contractual bands such as Beth and I talked with CSC about this last week and they told us the following Gas The Altra system handles the overtake above as another tier in the pricing to bill the penalties The invoice combines it into one lineitem with the first tier so when it is booked to the general ledger it is not segregated They do provide the customer with a breakout independently For undertakes the administration is manual Erich Evans CSC Gas Supervisor told us he was confident in that his staff is monitoring the bands and applying penalties as applicable He did tell us that in the past the Gas Desk has communicated to CSC that they did not want the penalties accessed for the undertakes He also said that customers have a tendancy to dispute the undertake penalties In the HP abd STAT systems the efforts are also manual Once again he is confident that his staff is administering the penalties The exception to this is twofold First of all when CSC acquired these systems and contracts formerly the Enron DublinAccess Energy deals from EES in there was no review of the contracts to ensure the system had cpatured the terms correctly CSC simply continued to invoice as EES had For new deals entered into from their takeover in CSC actually received the contracts and interpreted them to capture the data in their systems This practice continued until when the deal ticket concept was introduced pushing the burden to EES for the correct data capture The process was gradual but CSC feels that by that almost of the deals were captured through the deal ticket process Therefore there is exposure that the deal setup within CSCs systems is not accurate and consequently the bands are not being monitored for compliance Second since the deal ticket process was effective CSCs administration of bands is reliant on communications from EES through the deal ticket In either scenario our deal cleanup team will reveal any inaccurate deals and our historical cleanup team will be able to calculate the exposures CSC is providing a listing of billed penaltiesdisputed penalties by Friday POWER CSC is aware of only one contract with this scenario We do not believe this to be true and need to locate some power contracts to follow through their systems I need your help with this Terry Can someone on the Phoenix team provide me with a listing of any contracts that the team has looked at with this contractual implications Evan Can your service managers also provide examples of contracts that they know have the contract language Mark As we discussed on Friday I need your team to review the GNO contractsinvoices and let me know if they are monitoring this Please let me know ASAP on Monday when I can expect this info I will assign someone tomorrow to birddog this for me I need an answer and a plan if it is not being monitored by Tuesday to determine EESs exposure I appreciate your help Brenda x Original Message From ONeil Murray P Sent Fri PM To Herod Brenda F Cc Stokley Chris Subject FW Contracts Brenda In talking with Chris he was able to round up these newly signed deal customers as having the band terms included in their contracts See customers in email from Chris In addition when checking with others in the EES organization regarding the old contracts he was told that most of the older contracts which have been in place from to current have the band terms included in them as well I would think that our best bet is to get together with project Phoenix resources and see if we can get examples of contracts which are handled by each of the settlement resources we have CSC Avista Enron Let me know if you wish for me to drive this forward or if you have it covered FYII will be in Houston next week Thanks MO Original Message From Stokley Chris Sent Friday August PM To ONeil Murray P Subject Contracts Perry Todd says Any of them PacBell Home Depot Sysco EOP Messer Ind Pepsi Bottling

FW CAISO Notice Cash Allocation PoliciesNonPrivilegedpst Original Message From Woertz Byron mailto SentTuesday July PM ToISO Market Participants SubjectCAISO Notice Cash Allocation Policies ISO Market Participants Since Trade Month November which settled beginning in January payment defaults in the ISO markets have caused the ISO to pay less than th e full amount due Scheduling Coordinators SCs in the monthly cash clearin g process The purpose of this message is to describe the ISOs policies a nd procedures in settling the market when defaults occur As set forth in Section SABP of the ISO Tariff when payment defaults occur from SCs that have obligations to the ISOs markets Debtor SCs the shortfall is t o be prorated to SCs with net amounts due them Creditor SCs based on thei r outstanding balances The principles that drive how amounts are settled a nd defaults are allocated to Creditor SCs are summarized below Proportionate allocation of defaults The total amount of market defaults is allocated to the Creditor SCs on a proportionate basis such that each Cr editor SC receives the same percentage of their total net amount receivable for the month SCs are allowed to net the credits and debits on a monthly basis as described below The intent of the Tariff is to equitably distri bute market shortfalls only to those SCs that have net market receivables f or the period Each month is treated as a whole period Final and preliminary invoices ar e combined when possible see exception conditions below in allocating mar ket defaults Cash payments from the market are received in two stages pr eliminary and final At preliminary market payments are distributed base d on the preliminary amounts due to the Creditor SCs as set forth in the pr eliminary invoices Final invoices serve essentially as trueups to the pre liminary invoices and accordingly payments received at final are redistri buted to the extent possible to achieve trueup allocations for the whole m onth considering the combined amounts due the Creditor SCs from both the pr eliminary and final invoices Each month is treated as a discrete period Market defaults are generally allocated to the Creditor SCs that have amounts due for the month being set tled The exceptions to this rule involve SCs that are Creditor SCs in the current month but have default obligations relating to prior periods o r Debtor SCs that pay in the current month but have unpaid balances for prior months In the first instance the Creditor SC would not be paid to the extent of default obligations from prior months Amounts due to the C reditor SC would be allocated back to the default period and such proceeds would be allocated based on remaining amounts still owed for that period I n the second instance the current months payment is carried back and appli ed first to the oldest outstanding balance The proceeds would be distribut ed to the Creditor SCs for that earlier period based on the Creditor SCs un paid balances in that month With respect to the carry back of payments to the earliest period Pre and Post bankruptcy debts are deemed to be from d ifferent SCs GMC defaults are remedied as a first priority on market payments GMC is billed separately from market billings on both preliminary and final invoic es each month In the event of payment default on any GMC invoices at eit her preliminary or final market funds are transferred to satisfy GMC obli gations before any market distributions are made This first priority posi tion for GMC revenues is set forth in Section SABP of the ISO Tarif f Therefore when both GMC and market defaults occur as has occurred in each of the past few months the Creditor SCs have two reductions to the m arket clearing amounts ultimately paid an allocated portion of the GMC de fault and an allocated portion of the market default RMR invoices and pa yments are not affected by market or GMC defaults The RMR invoicing proce ss involves amounts due from the PTOs to the RMR Owners as set forth in mo nthly invoices processed through the ISOs systems However such amounts are invoiced independent of the ISOs market and GMC billing processes and accordingly market andor GMC defaults do not impact RMR related payments There are a number of factors that complicate the monthly process of alloca ting cash to Creditor SCs when defaults occur Some of these factors inclu de amounts received after payment date deadlines such amounts are typicall y included in the next distribution market payments due to Creditor SCs that default on GMC in the current mo nth such market allocations are reduced by the specific amount of the GMC default by the Creditor SC allocations to prior months not made unless the amount exceeds of that months billed amounts small invoices under are paid in full rather than the allocated pe rcentage For more information about these allocation issues or any other related mat ters please contact Melodie Iverson email aiso com mailto or Mike Epstein email m mailto at the ISO Byron B Woertz Jr Director Client Relations Phone Pager

FW Site Profile Consumption Issues in our contractsNonPrivilegedpst Original Message From Avs Mallik Sent Thursday August PM To Stokley Chris Cc Richter Jeff Herndon Rogers Black Don Subject Site Profile Consumption Issues in our contracts Chris As a follow up of our conversation here is a summary of contract issues I have tried to organize my comments into three major categories baseline bands and material change language Where Contracts were prior to Site Profile Desk took control Baseline Not specified in contracts A variety of mechanisms to build baseline postcontract including Calculating volumes on a forward basis ie first months Last months prior to contract closing Baseline volumes that grow by x Bands Annual bands Aggregation at all levels including utility state and national etc Material Change Language Varied unclear or vague language at least in my opinion Where we are now Baseline Two basic mechanisms intended to bring clarity Major Transactions ie any deal not priced from Matrix volumes explicitly specified in contract Minor transactions last months prior to contract closing with the understanding that Origination will collect bills required for booking within days of contract closing process details to be finalized Bands Monthly bands Aggregation allowed within same utilityvoltagefacility type groupings Material Change Language Unfortunately still unclear and inadequate see below for our proposals For example the Where we want to be Baseline Minor transactions A process needs to be in place in Services Department to collect the bills required for booking within days of contract closing Material Change Language This area needs to be really beefed up In my opinion material language should catch risks that are not explicitly modeled and priced At the moment I dont see material change language accomplishing this Issue Protecting for long term shifts in consumption The consumption bands which are set on monthly basis we are offering right now are intended to provide normal weather and operating flexibility With this assumption we currently price consumption risk as a probabilistic process as opposed to pricing using the classic straddle approach simultaneous call put Any step changes in consumption such as The Limited adding additional display area or Tyco Health Care Products adding new production shifts violate this assumption I propose either adding language that captures this steps or price these steps explicitly Given the lack of quality actual data the second alternative would be an educated guess at this point Recently I proposed verbally to be fair the following language to Jim Wood ProductsOrigination If a Material Change defined below has occurred EESO or Customer may request that the commodity pricing be restructured to account for such Material Change A Material Change shall be any intentional or unintentional change including energy efficiency upgrades to the processes or operations conducted at any of the Facilities or other similar occurrences that i change a Facility Accounts consumption of electricity or natural gas at such Facility Account by more than of the Facility Accounts Consumption Baseline over any six consecutive months ie Facility Accounts Actual Consumption divided by Facility Accounts Baseline Consumption equals less than or more than or ii change a Facility Account s monthly onpeak usage ratio for electricity at such Facility Account by more than of Facility Accounts monthly onpeak usage ratio baseline over any six consecutive months The Facility Account monthly onpeak usage ratio equals the monthly onpeak Facility Account usage divided by the total monthly Facility Account usage Jims immediate reaction was mixed He felt that customers may feel that we are giving them volumetric flexibility on one hand and taking it back with the other He said on material change may be more palatable Issue Sudden Load Swings in Short Term Although the monthly bands protect us on monthly volume swings they are not very effective in preventing sudden unplanned short term load swings triggering imbalance penalties Here the language currently in contracts that is supposed to protect us against this risk Notice of Operational Changes You agree to promptly advise us of any event reasonably known to you that may impact energy usage at any Account eg equipment installations outages shutdowns repairs openings or closings changes in operating hours by an amount without regard to weatherrelated effects greater than either i of the Actual Usage for such Account during the same Billing Cycle in the prior year or ii MW each an Operational Change If you fail to notify us of an Operational Change you will reimburse us for any Energy Imbalance Charges incurred by you or us as a result of such Operational Change This language has at least three problems No compensation mechanism specified if customer does not deliver on this requirement Is and or MW justifiable especially given the differences in imbalance treatment across physical markets No clear process ie minimum time frame for notice contact information specified for customer to deliver this notice I would modify this language to something like Notice of Operational Changes Customer agrees to advise EESI at least two days hours in advance to the contacts listed in Schedule by fax or email of any event that may impact energy demand at any of its Accounts eg equipment installations outages shutdowns repairs openings or closings changes in operating hours by an amount greater than either i of the Hourly Load for such Account during the same hour in the prior year or ii MW of demand each an Operational Change If such Customer fails to notify EESI of an Operational Change Customer will reimburse EESI for any Energy Imbalance Charges incurred by the Customer or EESI as a result of such Operational Change The mechanism for penalty calculation is specified in Schedule Hope this helps Mallik Forwarded by Mallik AvsHOUEES on AM Enron Energy Services From Mike D Smith AM To Mallik ES cc Subject Form Here is the master Embedded Picture Device Independent Bitmap

FW April dataNonPrivilegedpst Original Message From Mertz Jeanette mailto Sent Monday August PM To Stokley Chris Cc Almeida Keoni Madeiros Glenna Russell Mike Subject April data Chris I am hoping you can give me a little more information on the problems that occurred for Trade Day April There is a post final dispute being processed and I am a little confused on the problem EPMI had when processing and submitting this data What I understand is that the data for all zones was submitted with null values however we have two versions in our system the first was received on June and the second version was received on August For all of your demand zones PGE SCE and SDG there are no differences in the two versions of data submitted Please look into this as soon as you can It is important that we have accurate and correct data for your Post final dispute If you have any questions please dont hesitate to give me a call Thanks Jeanette Mertz Data Quality Auditor California ISO

am not sure the best way to approach it The gist of it is that I am worried about the VM group and their reputation on the floor Ill give you a couple of examples as to why Chris Mallory came to me and starting asking me questions about charges that go w impor ts and exportsI briefly answered but told him to talk to VM He said he didnt really know who to talk to who would be able to answer his question s wout Heather you or myself back there and he also did not know Jim R eyes name until he asked me yesterday Bill came over the Darren today concerned that he had been charged cong incorrectly bc when Bill had che cked CAISO the cong prices were all Not a huge deal that this happene d but Jim needs to be signing off on the Flash i dont know if he is or not and cong charges should always be closely monitored and I dont think that this is the first day that Bill has been incorrectly charged cong Richter asked me who would be the person in VM that should help Tim Coffing his new analyst that moved up here to deal w looking at the EES wholesa le settlements Jeff didnt know who would be the best bc he doesnt real ly know the VM team anymore I suggested Kit bc he seems to be good at d igging into problems and getting answers Essentially I think that the traders do not know all of the new faces wha t they are doing and who they should be talking to You were always very c oncerned about the visibilityavailability of the VM team as well as the cr edibility and I think these are suffering right now And of course on top of all of this is VMS Do you think I should send this to Scotty Murray Without any management being here I think it is tough to keep a heartbeat on the feeling of the t raders and I think that is part of the problem And I assume things will i mprove w Scotty here but he needs to build relationships on the floor as well I am not trying to be critical of anyone or step on any toes but I am conc erned Please let me know what you thinkthanks and sorry to add a little more t o your plate of concerns KN
